items.title: ASIA GOLD Record gold rally cools Indian buying; China discounts narrow
items.author: Sherin Varghese, Rajendra Jadhav
items.summary:
- India’s domestic gold hit a record 139,286 rupees/10g with spot near $4,530.60/oz, driven by speculative buying and rate-cut expectations; dealers offered discounts up to $61/oz over official prices.
- In China, discounts narrowed to $15–$30/oz from $64, aided by a firmer yuan; weak retail demand persists despite rate-cut hopes and limited imports.
- Regional notes: Singapore premiums $0.50–$3.50/oz; Hong Kong at parity to a $2/oz premium; Japan discounts $0.50–$6/oz; festive travel dampens Indian purchases.

items.title: Silver tops $75 as gold and platinum surge to records
items.author: Sherin Varghese

items.title: Platinum hits record high on tight supply, EU combustion-engine ban reversal
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Platinum hits an all-time high at $2,413.62/oz by 03:04 GMT, up 8% and on track for its largest annual gain.
- The rally is driven by tight supply and a surprise EU reversal of the 2035 combustion-engine ban.
- Investor funds are moving away from gold into platinum, supporting the rally.

items.title: Asia stocks rise to six-week high; precious metals on a tear
items.author: Ankur Banerjee
items.summary:
- Asian equities rose to six-week highs as year-end risk appetite improved, with Japan's Topix higher and Korea's KOSPI up.
- Gold and silver surged—gold near a fresh peak and silver up sharply—supported by central-bank demand and ETF inflows.
- The dollar softened as liquidity thins into year-end, while markets weigh BoJ policy cues and potential Fed cuts next year.

items.title: India's water crunch brews risks for beverage giants

items.title: Rupee dithers, state-run banks intermittently blunt dollar bids
items.author: Jaspreet Kalra

items.title: Spot silver extends rally to hit $75 per ounce for first time
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Spot silver rose to about $75/oz, up 3.5% to $74.46 at 02:29 GMT, after an intraday high of $75.14. 
- The rally was underpinned by robust industrial and investment demand, tighter inventories, geopolitical tensions and bets on further U.S. rate cuts. 
- An image from Munich shows gold and silver bars in safe-deposit boxes as of Jan 10, 2025.

items.title: Indian shares subdued on thin year-end trade
items.author: Bharath Rajeswaran

items.title: Gold hits record high on safe-haven demand, Fed rate-cut bets
items.author: Reuters

items.title: Oil rises slightly as market weighs supply risks
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Oil prices edged higher after the U.S. tightened pressure on Venezuelan crude and coordinated airstrikes in Nigeria, with Brent at $62.29 and WTI at $58.41 as of 0606 GMT.
- Traders stayed subdued ahead of Christmas, citing supply-side disruptions and a murky demand outlook for next year.
- Kazakh CPC exports are seen falling about a third in December after a Ukrainian drone attack, while the EIA data due Monday could illuminate demand in the world's largest oil consumer.

items.title: Serbia supports talks with Hungary's Mol over sale of sanctioned NIS oil firm
items.author: Reuters

items.title: China says it hopes firms seek lawful, balanced solutions over TikTok deal
items.author: Reuters
items.summary: - The Chinese commerce ministry urged that TikTok handover solutions comply with Chinese laws and balance all parties' interests. - ByteDance signed binding agreements transferring control of TikTok's U.S. operations to a consortium including Oracle, aiming to avert a U.S. ban. - China called on the U.S. to cooperate in a fair, open, transparent, and non-discriminatory environment to support continued operation of Chinese firms in the U.S.

items.title: Foreign-branded phone shipments in China more than doubled on year in Nov, CAICT data shows
items.author: Reuters
items.summary: - Nov 2025 total mobile phone shipments up 1.9% YoY to 30.16 million. - Foreign-branded devices rose 128.4% YoY to 6.93 million, led by iPhones. - The rebound signals renewed demand for foreign-brand handsets in China.

items.title: Democratic governors call on Trump administration to lift freeze on offshore wind projects
items.author: Jasper Ward

items.title: Nvidia will license Groq tech, hire its executives
items.author: Stephen Nellis
items.summary: - Nvidia will license Groq’s inference-focused tech on a non-exclusive basis and hire Groq’s founders to join Nvidia, while Groq stays independent.\n- The arrangement mirrors a trend of licensing startups and hiring leadership rather than full acquisitions, with examples from Microsoft and Meta.\n- Antitrust scrutiny is a risk; Nvidia aims to bolster its inference capabilities amid competitive pressure, while Groq’s cloud business and on-chip SRAM approach remain central.

items.title: Serbia's NIS gets US approval to negotiate sale of Russian stake
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- The U.S. has allowed NIS to negotiate the sale of its Russian owner's stake, with a March 24 deadline, amid OFAC sanctions that halted crude deliveries via JANAF and shut the Pancevo refinery.
- Ownership remains split among Gazprom (11.3%), Gazprom Neft (44.9%, a sanctioned unit), the Serbian government (29.9%), and minor shareholders; sanctions and waivers have evolved since October.
- President Vucic said Gazprom is in talks with Hungary's MOL about selling its majority stake in NIS, potentially reshaping control and sanctions exposure.

items.title: Canadian dollar rises to five-month high despite downbeat factory sales
items.author: Fergal Smith
items.summary:
- CAD firmed to near five-month high vs USD, aided by higher commodity prices and oil gains.
- November factory sales fell 1.1% and Q3 GDP beat expectations, with BoC minutes showing policy uncertainty.
- Softer USD, narrower rate spreads, U.S. data surprises, and holiday trading ahead of Christmas/Boxing Day supported the move.

items.title: US $1.7 billion Powerball jackpot offers a chance at a festive fortune
items.author: Aleksandra Michalska

items.title: Louis Dreyfus' finance chief Patrick Treuer dies
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Patrick Treuer, CFO of Louis Dreyfus Company, died unexpectedly.
- He joined LDC in 2014; arrangements for his successor as Group CFO will be announced in due course.
- LDC is part of the ABCD quartet of global crop merchants with ADM, Bunge and Cargill.

items.title: Italy watchdog orders Meta to halt WhatsApp terms barring rival AI chatbots
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- AGCM orders Meta to suspend WhatsApp terms that could bar rival AI chatbots as it probes potential abuse of a dominant position.
- Meta says the decision is flawed and will appeal; the probe began in July and was widened in November to cover WhatsApp Business terms.
- EU antitrust regulators are conducting a parallel inquiry, coordinating with the European Commission, amid US pushback and criticism from the Trump administration.

items.title: Hyundai to recall over 51,000 vehicles in US over risk of fire, NHTSA says
items.author: Reuters

items.title: South African rand climbs on precious metal market frenzy
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Rand edges ~0.1% firmer to about 16.66 per dollar as precious metals rally.
- Johannesburg Top-40 climbs ~0.8% with thinner trade from year-end holidays.
- ETM Analytics says the rand should finish 2025 on the front foot, supported by higher metals prices and a stronger trade surplus, with a >12% year-to-date gain.
